intro: Leucanthemopsis, commonly known as the white ragwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its bright yellow to orange flowers, which are surrounded by white ray florets. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is native to regions of Europe and Asia. Leucanthemopsis has a compact growth habit and is often found in open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. It is considered a perennial herb that thrives in full sun to partial shade.
